COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY
GEORGE A. SMATHERS, FLA.
February 24, 1967
Mr. Myron M. Curry
Director, KFJM & CCTV
The University of North Dakota
Grand Forks, North Dakota 58201
Dear Mike:
Thank you very much for your letter. I appreciate your, kind
remarks.
•
I have done a little investigating into the bill for educa¬
tional radio facilities that you are working on, and I find
your situation not quite as favorable as it might have seemed.
At the staff level, Senator Magnuson's office said that the
Senator will introduce the educational television facilities
bill drafted in the White House, and that it was very unlikely
that this would include anything for educational radio.
From here on in the game is pretty hard to call, but often
times in these situations the Senator who has agreed to intro¬
duce something asked in a presidential message has consulted
with the White House as to terms of the legislation. This
Suggests that your organization should be concentrating its
activities on the White House and Senator Magnuson at the
moment.
I tell you all this only in an effort to be helpful. This is
all probably something that the professional staff of your
organization already know. It may very well be that they are
now working closely with the White House.
Yours very truly
James G. Meeker
Legislative Assistant to
Senator Quentin N. Burdick
JGM:w
